node.title: Police say man in custody had 'no family connection' to Cleo Smith
node.description: WA police hail the successful search for Cleo Smith as "one of the most remarkable days in policing in Western Australia"Â and thank her parents and community for their resilience,
node.content:
["Missing four-year-old Cleo Smith has been found alive and well after disappearing almost three weeks ago.", "WA Police said she was found inside a locked house in Carnarvon. Western Australia Police Commissioner Chris Dawson spoke to ABC Radio Perth this morning.\u00a0", "Here's what he had to say.", "
'One of the most remarkable days in policing in Western Australia'
", "", "
A missing person poster for four-year-old Cleo Smith in Carnarvon on October 29, 2021, 14 days after she disappeared from her family's tent at the Blowholes campgrounds.(ABC News: Evelyn Manfield)
", "Commissioner Dawson said\u00a0the day would go down in history in Western Australia.", "\"To find a little girl, a vulnerable little girl, after 18 days. Obviously, people think the worst.\u00a0But importantly, hope was never lost,\" he said.", "\"I think Australia is rejoicing. It is such a wonderful outcome.\"", "Commissioner Dawson said that while police never gave up hope of finding Cleo, the longer the search went on the tougher it became.", "\"Having been around the block a bit, we obviously were very, very concerned [after] so many days passed,\" he said.", "\"I'm so pleased the team kept going, they were not going to leave any stone unturned. They didn't and it's just a wonderful outcome as a consequence.\"", "
Man in custody has no connection to family
", "", "
Western Australia Police Commissioner Chris Dawson thanked Cleo's parents, the localy community and volunteers.(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "Commissioner Dawson said there was very little he could say about the man taken into custody.", "\"There is no family connection,\" he said.", "Commissioner Dawson said he could only confirm that a 36-year-old man had\u00a0been taken into custody and that police were still questioning him.", "\"There was some information we followed up on. We had been following a lot of the forensic leads and it led us to a particular house,\" he said.", "", "
Cleo Smith was abducted at the Blowholes campsite, about 75 kilometres north of Carnarvon in Western Australia.
", "Commissioner Dawson said in the vision, Cleo is seen smiling.", "Commissioner Dawson said the effort to find Cleo had involved every resource at the disposal of the Western Australia Police.", "\"We put everything we had at it. Our homicide squad \u2014 trained, experienced investigators and detectives, our analysts, our technical people, drone pilots, air-wing, the whole lot,\" he said.", "
Cleo's parents, local community praised for their resilience
", "", "
The turnoff to the Blowholes camp ground, where missing WA girl Cleo Smith was last seen.\u00a0(ABC News: James Carmody)
", "Commissioner Dawson said Cleo's parents,\u00a0Jake Gliddon and Ellie Smith, deserved credit for never giving up hope and supporting police in their investigation.", "\"Look, Ellie and Jake are clearly emotional, but importantly they never gave up hope. To be able to reunite them with their daughter is just such a wonderful thing. They're strong people,\" he said.", "Cleo's parents still had a \"tough\u00a0journey\" ahead of them, according to Commissioner Dawson, but he said there would be continued support from police.", "", "
Cleo Smith was reported missing by her family from a campsite north of Carnarvon in WA on October 16, 2021. Picture date April 1, 2021.(Facebook: Ellie Smith)
", "He also praised the local community for coming together to support the investigation.", "\"I do give credit to the community. We did get some information about a car being seen and things like that. I can say we are thankful for the way the community came together, because this strikes at the very heart of every parent, of every Australian,\" he\u00a0said.", "\"To have a young child abducted from\u00a0an iconic location, camping with the family \u2014 it touches everyone. No-one is left untouched by this\"", "Commissioner Dawson said investigations would continue today, but\u00a0he would personally head\u00a0out to Carnarvon to thank the local community and local police."]
